main event: The report documents a sighting of an unidentified aerial object on March 12, 1949. The object was observed from an aircraft, and its appearance and behavior were detailed in the report.
interesting points: The object was observed from a considerable distance, possibly fifty miles, with a 35° elevation from the horizon.
It appeared as a large object with a reddish-yellow leading edge and a blue trailing area, with a straight leading edge and a fiery construction.
The object was seen to be quite large, approximately six or eight times larger than a falling star.
The sighting lasted around five seconds, and the object was observed descending from the sky.
The observers were inside a DC-3 aircraft that had just passed Chariton, Iowa, and was approximately forty miles S-30°E of Des Moines' Municipal Airport.
location: Near Des Moines' Municipal Airport, Iowa
